sections.title: Why build your own Kanban CRM?
sections.content:
Off-the-shelf CRM solutions often come with a steep learning curve, unnecessary features, and recurring costs that quickly add up. They force you to adapt your unique sales process to their rigid structure. With Kliv, you can design a Kanban CRM that perfectly mirrors your workflow, giving your team an intuitive visual tool that actually helps them sell.

Imagine a CRM that doesn't just manage data, but actively guides your team through the sales cycle with clear, actionable stages. A custom Kanban CRM provides exactly this, transforming complex sales processes into simple, visual boards that enhance focus and productivity.

sections.title: The power of a custom Kanban CRM
sections.content:
## Standard CRMs vs. Kanban-centric design

Traditional CRMs are often database-centric, requiring extensive data entry and navigation through multiple menus. This can lead to:

- **Information overload**: Too much data, not enough clarity.
- **Steep learning curves**: Teams struggle to adopt complex systems.
- **Fixed workflows**: Difficulty adapting to unique sales methodologies.
- **Hidden bottlenecks**: Hard to visually identify where leads get stuck.
- **Recurring costs**: Expensive subscriptions even for unused features.

## Why a custom Kanban CRM stands out

By building your own Kanban CRM with Kliv, you gain several distinct advantages:

### Visual clarity and intuitive workflow
Kanban boards provide an at-a-glance overview of your entire sales pipeline. Each card represents a lead or deal, moving through customized stages (columns) from initial contact to closed-won. This visual approach makes it easy to:

- **Identify progress**: See exactly where each lead stands.
- **Spot bottlenecks**: Instantly notice stages with too many stalled cards.
- **Prioritize tasks**: Focus on leads that need immediate attention.
- **Collaborate effectively**: Teams can easily understand and contribute to shared pipelines.

### Tailored to your sales process
Every business has a unique sales journey. Generic CRMs force you into their predefined stages. With a custom Kanban CRM, you design the columns, define the card details, and configure the automation rules to precisely match your sales cycle, industry nuances, and team's way of working.

### Cost-effective & scalable ownership
Investing in a custom solution with Kliv means a one-time build that you own. No more endless subscription fees for features you don't use. As your business grows, you can easily add new boards, custom fields, integrations, and automation rules without being locked into a vendor's pricing tiers or feature limitations.

### Enhanced team adoption
When a tool is built specifically for your team's needs and processes, adoption rates skyrocket. An intuitive visual interface reduces training time and empowers sales reps to manage their pipeline more efficiently, leading to better focus and higher conversion rates.

## Use cases across industries

A custom Kanban CRM isn't just for traditional sales. It can be adapted for various client-facing processes:

**Professional Services**: Manage client projects from proposal to delivery, tracking each stage and client communication.

**Real Estate**: Visualize property sales pipelines, from listing to closing, including prospect management.

**Recruitment Agencies**: Track candidates through the hiring process, from initial screening to offer acceptance.

**Marketing Agencies**: Manage client campaigns, from initial brief to content delivery and performance tracking.

## Building with Kliv's AI advantage

Kliv leverages AI to make custom software development accessible. You describe your desired Kanban CRM in plain language, and the platform assists in generating the core application. This process is:

- **Fast**: Go from idea to functional prototype in hours.
- **Flexible**: Easily refine and adjust your CRM as your needs evolve.
- **Code-optional**: No deep programming knowledge required.

Embrace the clarity and efficiency of a Kanban CRM built specifically for your business. It's time to gain a competitive edge by truly understanding and optimizing your customer relationships.

sections.title: Kanban CRM ideas to get you started

items.title:
Sales pipeline manager with lead scoring and task assignment for a B2B SaaS company that closes deals in 4 stages (Lead, Qualified, Proposal, Won/Lost). Each card should display company name, contact person, deal value, and last activity date. Include automated notifications if a deal is stuck in a stage for too long, and enable drag-and-drop for moving deals between stages, automatically updating their status and assigning follow-up tasks to account managers. Make sure to allow custom fields for deal size and industry. Also, add the capability to filter deals by assigned sales rep, deal value, and close date. Integrate with an email sending feature to send automated follow-ups based on stage changes. Finally, include a dashboard to show conversion rates per stage and overall pipeline value. Allow creating new leads directly from the board and linking them to existing or new companies. Make the board accessible to a team of 10 sales reps, with each rep only seeing their assigned leads, while sales managers can see all leads. Make sure historical data is kept for reporting purposes. Give me the code to implement this in Python. Ensure it also supports file uploads to each deal card, such as proposals or contracts. Furthermore, add a 'Lost Reason' field for deals moved to the 'Lost' stage, with predefined options. Also, implement a search bar to find deals by company name or contact. Add a 'Next Step' field on each card to remind sales reps of the immediate action required. Add robust user authentication and role-based access control, so sales reps can only edit their own deals, but managers can edit any deal. Show me how to set up the database schema for this. Include automated weekly email reports to sales managers summarizing pipeline activity and team performance. Add integration with a popular calendar service (e.g., Google Calendar) to allow scheduling meetings directly from a deal card. Finally, create a feature to track email communications associated with each deal card, so all correspondence is visible in one place. Add the ability to set reminders for specific deal cards. Include a notification system for new leads assigned or deals nearing their close date. Allow users to add comments to deal cards for internal team discussions. Make sure the UI is responsive and works well on mobile devices for sales reps on the go. Provide a simple API to integrate with external lead generation sources. How do I deploy this to a cloud environment like AWS or Google Cloud? Add custom branding options for the application interface.

What are the most effective ways to optimize performance for a large number of deals (e.g., 10,000+)? What kind of real-time analytics can be integrated into the dashboard to track key sales metrics? Provide an example of how to implement a 'deal aging' metric to identify deals that have been in a stage for too long.

How can I add AI capabilities to auto-assign leads based on criteria or predict deal outcomes based on historical data?

Show me how to build a feature for sales forecasting based on the current pipeline. Add a 'probability of close' field that automatically updates as deals progress through the stages. Provide a simple way to import existing client data from a CSV file. Also, show me how to integrate with a VoIP system to log calls directly to deal cards. Finally, add a feature to create proposals or contracts directly from a deal card using templates. Include a customer feedback loop system to gather insights after a deal is closed, whether won or lost. Implement a referral tracking system within the CRM. Provide guidance on ensuring GDPR compliance for customer data. How can I facilitate A/B testing of different sales processes within the CRM itself? Implement a win-loss analysis report to identify common reasons for lost deals. Add the ability to create and track sales quotas for each sales representative. Introduce a gamification element to motivate sales teams. Allow for custom deal types beyond just 'sales' (e.g., 'Partnership', 'Service Contract'). Add a feature to track competitor involvement in deals. Provide a mechanism for sales managers to conduct deal reviews directly within the system.

Client intake and onboarding for a consulting firm that uses a 5-step process: Inquiry, Proposal, Contract, Onboarding, Active Client. Each client card should display client name, project type, status, and assigned consultant. Enable drag-and-drop functionality and automated email triggers for each stage change. Allow consultants to add notes and upload documents specific to each client. Include reporting on client onboarding timeframes. Add a task management feature for each client card to track onboarding checklist items. Provide custom fields for client industry and budget range. The system should support up to 50 active client projects. Implement a notification system for overdue onboarding tasks. How can I ensure data privacy and security for sensitive client information within this CRM? How can I integrate this CRM with my existing document management system (e.g., Google Drive)? Add a feature to generate an onboarding summary report for each client. Provide a way to capture client feedback at the end of the onboarding process. How can I implement a satisfaction score for the onboarding process? Add a feature for clients to securely log in and view their onboarding progress. Enable the creation of sub-tasks within each onboarding stage. Provide a clear audit trail for all changes to client cards. How can I ensure proper version control for uploaded client documents? Add a feature to assign priority levels to clients. Implement a robust search capability for client cards based on various criteria. What are the best practices for scaling this system as my client base grows? How can I use AI to automate routine onboarding tasks? Add a feature to track time spent by consultants on each client. Provide an overview dashboard of all ongoing client onboarding statuses, including potential bottlenecks. Include a feature to manage client subscriptions or service renewals automatically. Add automated reminders for payment deadlines. How can I integrate with an appointment scheduling tool? Provide a way to manage client communications history (emails, calls, meetings) for each client card. Add a feature to assign multiple consultants to a single client project. How can I create custom onboarding templates for different client types? Add a feature to track the return on investment (ROI) for each client. Implement a referral tracking system for new clients. Provide robust reporting on client acquisition channels. Add a feature to track client health scores. Discuss best practices for data migration if I'm switching from another CRM.

Customer support ticket management with escalation paths for a software company using a 4-tiered support system: New, Open, Resolved, Closed. Each ticket card should include customer name, issue description, priority level, and assigned agent. Implement drag-and-drop to manage ticket status and automated alerts for high-priority tickets. Allow agents to add solution notes and attach relevant files. Track average resolution time and agent performance. Provide a searchable knowledge base linked to ticket resolutions. Add a feature to automatically assign tickets based on agent availability or expertise. Implement customer satisfaction (CSAT) surveys upon ticket closure. How can I categorize incoming tickets using natural language processing (NLP)? Add a customer portal for users to submit and track their tickets. How can I integrate this with my email support system (e.g., Gmail, Outlook)? Provide a way to merge duplicate tickets. Add a feature to track SLA compliance for each ticket. Implement a notification system for customers on ticket status updates. Create a reporting dashboard for key support metrics (e.g., ticket volume, first response time). How can I use AI to suggest solutions based on past tickets? Add a feature to allow agents to collaborate on tickets. Provide a way to create post-mortems for major incidents. Implement a robust tagging system for tickets. How can I integrate with a live chat solution? Add a feature to escalate tickets to different departments (e.g., engineering). Provide sentiment analysis on customer interactions. How can I ensure the system remains performant with a large volume of tickets? Add a feature to track customer history and previous interactions. Provide a way to set up custom workflows for different issue types. How can I generate automated performance reports for individual agents and teams? Add a feature to manage agent schedules and capacity. Implement a system for tracking recurring issues. How can I provide access only to authorized support agents? Provide a clear audit log of all ticket changes. Suggest ways to handle multi-language support.

Job application tracking for an HR department with stages: Applied, Screened, Interviewed, Offer, Hired, Rejected. Each candidate card should show name, position, current stage, and last contact date. Enable drag-and-drop, automated email templates for each stage, and reminders for follow-ups. Allow recruiters to upload resumes and interview feedback. Include reporting on time-to-hire and candidate source. Add a feature to schedule interviews directly from the candidate card. Implement a robust search and filter system for candidates based on skills, experience, and keywords. Provide custom fields for desired salary and relocation needs. How can I integrate this with popular job boards (e.g., LinkedIn, Indeed)? Add a feature for hiring managers to leave structured feedback. Implement a notification system for new applications. How can I anonymize candidate data for diversity reporting? Add a feature to manage multiple job openings simultaneously. Provide robust access control for different HR roles. How can I use AI to screen resumes for desired keywords or traits? Add a feature to track referrals. Provide a clear audit trail for all changes made to candidate records. How can I generate compliance reports for hiring practices? Add a feature to send automated rejection emails. Implement a system for managing talent pools. How can I facilitate video interviews within the CRM? Add a feature to manage background checks and references. Provide robust analytics on candidate sources and pipeline conversion. How can I ensure GDPR compliance for candidate data? Add a feature to create and manage job descriptions within the system. Provide a way to track the interview panel's availability. How can I integrate with an e-signature solution for offer letters? Add a feature to track employee onboarding after they are hired.

items.answer: Building a basic Kanban CRM can take hours. A complex system with custom integrations and advanced features might take a few days of focused effort on the Kliv platform.
items.question: How long does it take to build a Kanban CRM with Kliv?

items.answer: No coding experience is required. Kliv's AI-powered platform allows you to describe your desired CRM functionality in plain language, and it assists in generating the application. It empowers non-technical users to bring their ideas to life.
items.question: Do I need to be a programmer to build a Kanban CRM?

items.answer: Yes, you can integrate your custom Kanban CRM with many existing business tools, including email clients, marketing automation platforms, and accounting software, typically through their APIs.
items.question: Can I integrate my custom CRM with my existing business tools?

items.answer: With Kliv, you completely own the application you build, including all its data and source code. You have full control over where your data is stored and how it's handled, ensuring maximum privacy and security tailored to your needs.
items.question: Who owns the data and the application I build?

items.answer: While SaaS CRMs involve ongoing subscription fees, a custom CRM built with Kliv is generally a one-time development investment. Many businesses find that cost savings become substantial over time, often recouping the initial investment within a year.
items.question: How does the cost compare to off-the-shelf CRM solutions?

items.answer: Absolutely. One of the primary benefits of building a custom CRM is its flexibility. You can easily add new features, modify workflows, change reporting, or scale the system up or down as your business needs evolve, without vendor lock-in.
items.question: Can I modify my custom CRM after it's built?

items.answer: Building your own CRM can offer higher security because you control the infrastructure, data storage, and access protocols. You don't rely on a third-party vendor's security practices, minimizing external vulnerabilities.
items.question: Is a custom Kanban CRM more secure than a SaaS CRM?

items.answer: Kliv provides comprehensive AI-driven guidance and tools throughout the development process, including debugging and optimization suggestions. You'll have the resources to maintain and evolve your application independently, without relying on external support contracts.
